page.title: 12Local History, Milton Ernest
page.content: {Milton Ernest Hall}was designed by {William Butterfield,}was built in 1856 and is a splendid example of{Victorian {Gothic}architecture. It was used as a family home until 1870, was owned by {The 2nd Lord Ampthill}from 1906 to 1919 and then sold back to the original family. During the{2nd World {War}it became a nerve centre for the {American 8th Army Air Force,}where {Glenn Miller,}the famous Big Band leader performed concerts. It became a hotel and restaurant in 1968 and in 1985 it became a private nursing home for the elderly. It is set in large gardens on the northern banks of the {Great Ouse River. {Church}(see Religion in Milton Ernest) {Large Houses:}The Grange, Milton House East and West Manor Farms, The Old Vicarage and The Mill House. There is a former{Blacksmith's Forge}by the A6.
